adjectives.description: ulcerate (comparative more ulcerate, superlative most ulcerate)

entries.meaning: (palynology, of a pollen grain) Having an ulcus, a rounded pore-like aperture, at one or both poles.

verbs.description: ulcerate (third-person singular simple present ulcerates, present participle ulcerating, simple past and past participle ulcerated)

entries.meaning: (medicine, transitive) To cause an ulcer to develop.
examples: The surface was ulcerated by trauma.
The tissue ulcerated shortly after exposure.
